New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers moved to an NBA-best 32-4 on the season
Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers won 129-122, snapping Oklahoma City Thunder's 15-game winning streak
Cleveland Cavaliers exploited Oklahoma City Thunder's defense by making 8 of 14 corner 3-pointers
Cleveland Cavaliers' role players made their 3s (10 for 15 combined) while Oklahoma City's role players didn't
Cleveland Cavaliers outscored Oklahoma City Thunder by six in the paint and out-rebounded them by two
Cleveland Cavaliers pulled in four critical offensive rebounds in an 18-second span between the 1:37 and 1:19 marks
Pre-Game Insights: Oklahoma City Thunder's approach to defense is to play aggressively and generate turnovers
Thunder's style allows opponents one high-value shot: corner 3s, which they take 11.3 per game
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland Cavaliers' win over Oklahoma City Thunder was their biggest win of the season
Cleveland Cavaliers' role players, including Max Strus, Dean Wade, and Caris LeVert, made crucial 3-pointers
Oklahoma City Thunder's reliance on Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Jalen Williams to create shots was a problem
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chet Holmgren's absence was noted, as he could have helped the Thunder defend the paint
Thunder's offense struggled to generate easier shots against Cleveland's elite defense
Thunder may need to add a creator at the trade deadline to improve their offense
Others: Oklahoma City Thunder's 15-game winning streak was snapped
Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen outplayed Isaiah Hartenstein in the paint
